extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds large shrimp in the shell or shelled

title: Pan-Fried Shrimp with Lemon and Ouzo
summary: Pan-Fried Shrimp with Lemon and Ouzo is a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian recipe with 6 servings. One serving contains 224 calories, 23g of protein, and 9g of fat. For $2.95 per serving, this recipe covers 12% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works best as a main course, and is done in about 10 minutes. This recipe from Food and Wine has 1 fans. Head to the store and pick up salt, lemon juice, ouzo, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 41%. This score is pretty good. Try Fried Mussels in Ouzo Batter, Salt-cured Ouzo Shrimp, and Greek Millet Saganaki with Shrimp and Ouzo for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 99 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: In a large, shallow dish, combine the ouzo, lemon juice and cayenne. Add the shrimp and toss to coat thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 1/2 hours or for up to 2 hours.                                               Dry the shrimp. In a large skillet, heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of the oil until shimmering. Add half of the shrimp and cook over high heat, stirring, until golden and just cooked, 2 minutes. Season with salt and transfer to a platter. Repeat with the remaining oil and shrimp. Serve hot or warm.

steps.step: In a large, shallow dish, combine the ouzo, lemon juice and cayenne.
Add the shrimp and toss to coat thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 1/2 hours or for up to 2 hours.
Dry the shrimp. In a large skillet, heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of the oil until shimmering.
Add half of the shrimp and cook over high heat, stirring, until golden and just cooked, 2 minutes. Season with salt and transfer to a platter. Repeat with the remaining oil and shrimp.
